Container.Name: NginxProxyManager
Container.Overview: Nginx Proxy Manager enables you to easily forward to your websites running at home or otherwise, including free SSL, without having to know too much about Nginx or Letsencrypt. [br][br]
Container.Description: Nginx Proxy Manager enables you to easily forward to your websites running at home or otherwise, including free SSL, without having to know too much about Nginx or Letsencrypt. [br][br]

Config.Name: Web UI Port
Config.Description: Port used to access the web interface of the application.

Config.Name: HTTP Port
Config.Description: Port used to serve HTTP requests.<br><b>NOTE:</b> Your router should be configured to forward port <i>80</i> to this port. If your router doesn't allow setting the destination/internal IP address, this <b><i>must</i></b> be set to <b>80</b>.

Config.Name: HTTPs Port
Config.Description: Port used to serve HTTPs requests.<br><b>NOTE:</b> Your router should be configured to forward port <i>443</i> to this port. If your router doesn't allow setting the destination/internal IP address, this <b><i>must</i></b> be set to <b>443</b>.

Config.Name: Config Directory
Config.Description: This is where the application stores its configuration, log and any files needing persistency.<br>Container path: /app/config

Config.Name: User ID
Config.Description: ID of the user the application runs as.

Config.Name: Group ID
Config.Description: ID of the group the application runs as.

Config.Name: Umask
Config.Description: Mask that controls how file permissions are set for newly created files. The value of the mask is in octal notation.

Config.Name: Niceness (priority)
Config.Description: Priority at which the application should run. A niceness value of -20 is the highest priority and 19 is the lowest priority.<br><b>NOTE:</b> Setting a negative value requires additional permissions. Thus, <i><b>--cap-add=SYS_NICE</b></i> must be added in <i>Extra Parameters</i> (shown when <i>Advanced View</i> is enabled).

Config.Name: Config Directory
Config.Description: This is where the application stores its configuration, log and any files needing persistency.<br>Container path: /config
